newsitem.title: INDIA: Japan's Toyota set to seal India joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Japan's Toyota set to seal India joint venture.

text.p: India's Kirloskar group is set to sign a joint-venture agreement with Japan's Toyota Motor Corp to manufacture sports utility vehicles, group executive Vikram Kirloskar told Reuters on Thursday.
Kirloskar, who is managing director of Mysore Kirloskar Ltd , one of the group's leading companies, said total investment in the joint venture would be $170 million.
"We will be signing the joint venture agreement with Toyota on Monday at Toyota's headquarters in Japan," Kirloskar said by telephone from the southern city of Bangalore.

Kirloskar said Toyota would hold 74 percent of the joint venture and the Kirloskar group the rest. The plant, to be built at Bidadi, near Bangalore, would produce 2000cc "family recreational vehicles".
Start-up is scheduled for the second half of 1999 and the plant will initially product 50,000 units annually, he said.
Kirloskar told Reuters last month the sports utility vehicle would be a new variant of Toyota's popular Kijang model.
Analysts expect India's market for cars to grow to around one million units in 2000/2001 (April-March) from 345,355 in 1995/96.
